title-group.article-title: An exploratory method for determining optimal plot size in plant community studies

permissions.copyright-statement: © Department of Plant Taxonomy and Ecology, ELTE

abstract.p: In order to reduce the amount of data collection necessary to use the Juhász-Nagy model, the STATIS three-way technique is proposed for pilot analyses. The application of STATIS to two spatial processes, yields results approaching very well the synphenetic pattern as obtained by the Juhász-Nagy model. In particular, optimal size of plots can be identified, corresponding to one extreme of the second interstructure axis. In a similar way, the trajectories of plots along the spatial process, as they are represented on the first two principal components of the compromise result, show maximum distances from the center corresponding to maximum associatum.
